short_description: A land of contrasts, from the glittering modern cities to the ancient desert landscapes. Visit the holy city of Mecca, explore the ancient ruins of Madain Saleh, or experience the bustling markets and lively culture of Riyadh

alcohol_info: Drinking or possessing alcohol is prohibited in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Persons who drink or possess alcohol are subject to arrest and trial

tipping.hotels: It is common to tip for indivudual services despite service charge. Tip USD 1-2 for the porter and USD 2 per day for housekeeping
tipping.guides: Tip USD 10 per person for smaller groups and USD 5 per person for larger groups
tipping.restaurants: In Saudi Arabia tipping is expected to be between 10% and 15% for good service, unless there is a service charge added to the bill
tipping.taxis: In Saudi Arabia it is customary to tip driver up to 10% your taxi

weather.title: Saudi Arabia has a desert climate with extremely hot summers and mild winters. It experiences very little rainfall, and temperatures can reach scorching levels, particularly in the summer months

when_to_visit.title: Best for Red Sea
when_to_visit.short_description: Comfortable, warm temperatures perfect for enjoying Red Sea beaches and water sports

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Moderate warm temperatures with less fluctuation between day and night in desert areas. Great to visiting main cities and enjoying natural areas

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Extremely hot throughout most parts of Saudi Arabia. Outdoor activitiers will be difficult during this period

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Saudi Arabia depends on the region, but generally, the months of October to April offer milder temperatures, making it more comfortable to explore the country's historical sites and natural wonders
